intro: Viguiera leptodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ironweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces showy purple to pinkish flowers in late summer. Viguiera leptodonta is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
